column5: Your train of thought is similar to mine.  We should team up lol

I think kids who start  young with anything like a paper route,  lawn mowing, snow shoveling or other little enterprise have a head start, when it comes to understanding the value of a dollar.  I think kids should be exempt from such bylaws.

Your train of thought is similar to mine.  We should team up lol  You will probably get this then.... There are three words that have done more to kill productivity and innovation than any others in history..... STAFF MEETING MONDAY. LOL
How about  "time to reorganize"

So I guess every yard sale, garage sale and the like will have to be shut down now. I had one duffus on another fishing forum tell me that when I trade my home made pasta sauce for fish cleaning by a lady where my boat slip is I am supposed to pay taxes on the worth of the fish cleaning as it was income. Guess what he was? Yep, a By Law officer. And he was dead serious. This world of ours sure has some problems but kids selling worms?? Come on man!  A few years ago if you can recall the health dept's in Ontario were cracking down on service clubs and Churches for preparing and selling foods like cookies and pies not made in commercial kitchens that were not approved by the Gov. Another, Come on man!
Town of Midland requires you to buy a permit to have a garage / yard sale ! Fine for not having one minimum $500 to a maximum of $100,000 !!

Town of Midland requires you to buy a permit to have a garage / yard sale ! Fine for not having one minimum $500 to a maximum of $100,000 !!  I guess the mayor/reeve didn't see the as is sign on that .50 toaster they bought at a garage sale and when it stopping working after 2 yrs it was decided to clamp down on this kinda crap being sold on the public streets.... of that fair city.  Seriously, do you need a permit to have a kijiji sale too. Are bake/cookie/chocolate sales for the schools exempt at least. LOL
No, if you want to have a fund raising raffle you have to buy a licence to sell tickets in Midland!

No, if you want to have a fund raising raffle you have to buy a licence to sell tickets in Midland!  Wow is air still free there? LOL I would be saying to the council "that's nice" (anyone who is a fan of Mrs. Browns Boys will know what I am really thinking though.)

Only applies to baitfish. I wonder if the bait dealers pushed for that too though, I can recall a few times going to a bait store in Ontario for minnows and getting little smallmouth and trout mixed in with them.
Nothing is free in this province. Just take a look at what we pay in taxes to make my point.
Updated..... Cornwall Mayor, says changing the bylaw for one case would be asinine...  http://www.cbc.ca/m/news/canada/ottawa/topstories/cornwall-kids-defy-bylaw-to-stop-selling-worms-1.3176717

Updated..... Cornwall Mayor, says changing the bylaw for one case would be asinine...  http://www.cbc.ca/m/news/canada/ottawa/topstories/cornwall-kids-defy-bylaw-to-stop-selling-worms-1.3176717  Not for nothing but did anyone else notice how a "politician" knew right off the top of their head how to "cheat" the rules and still continue the activity. LOL
Does that mean I will earn what Kathleen Wynne makes? :-) No.  In a Communist State, everyone is equal.  And some are more equal than others.  lol
If you look at the picture in the article, you will see the complaint box is checked off.  Someone called and complained to the bylaw folks.  G

If you look at the picture in the article, you will see the complaint box is checked off.  Someone called and complained to the bylaw folks.  G Gerritt u are absolutely right on the complaint, the by law were just doing their job, and a neighbour was playing scrooge in the summer, hopfully the officials to be will put some of our tax payers dollars to good use in their next council meeting and make some ammendments to let kids be kids

Aw, come on Dad, just buy your kids a bike!  Ya thats the spirit. Give them what they want. No need to earn it. Im not saying your wrong, but the kids are stepping up. Who says dad has the cash to buy them?  The whole world is going for a crap.

Ya thats the spirit. Give them what they want. No need to earn it. Im not saying your wrong, but the kids are stepping up. Who says dad has the cash to buy them?  The whole world is going for a crap.  Maybe I'm wrong Brian, but I thought Mike was just kidding around with his comment and not intending it to be taken literally.  As I said though, I could be wrong.
Damit man use the  ME BAD
ME BAD  Your such a good guy Brian nobody will notice your little indiscretion

Sorry guys, but if its taking business away from local tackle shops then I'm for it.  If its just to lay down the law for any other reason then that I would definitely never raise a family there.  And how many 'Worms for Sale' signs do you pass by to any lake in the Kawarthas, that aren't a commercial business, theres tons of people that do this.  Hell, where I grew up in Sarnia, there was a guy that lived beside the arena who sold worms and minnows from his shed, just pull up, open the fridge, grab the worms, or fill a  bucket with minnows, put the money in the bin, drive away, all done by honour system.  Should we ban garage sales since they take away business from second hand stores?
This province is such a bunch of friggen whiners. It drives me nuts. Im about ready to leave here. The people suck!!  S.
This province is such a bunch of friggen whiners. It drives me nuts. Im about ready to leave here. The people suck!!  S. Don't let the door smack your  on the way out.
Whiners ..do gooders..nothing better to do than look out the window and rat out some kids..
These kids won't make 30k so no tax need to be collected and non sent in.

The MNR did the same to a kid just outside Beaverton back in the 80's. Shut down his roadside worm stand because a) not collecting PST   b} no bait sellers license.  As I recall, the end result was the CO being relocated to another jurisdiction.

Maybe I'm wrong Brian, but I thought Mike was just kidding around with his comment and not intending it to be taken literally.  As I said though, I could be wrong. Yup, definately just a joke.  No worries Brian.  It's not the first time someone didn't think I was funny!  lol

As far as I know, if they made a complaint it wouldn't/couldn't be anonymously. The kids will find out which stick up the bum neighbour shut them down. Sometimes makes you wonder about those guys who sell used golf balls living beside golf courses. Maybe I should make a call to my by-law officer as well.

I agree with what everyone has said. Let kids be kids and learn about life along the way. However none of us know the whole situation. Perhaps the kids or there customers created traffic flow problems on the road or sidewalk or threw away garbage that they never picked up but the next door neighbour had to deal with it. Eventually that would upset most of us.

Whatever the situation is, it's still a shame that a couple kids are trying to do something positive and make a few bucks to buy a bike.  Sure a big difference from so many kids today who never leave the TV or computer.  All I know is I'm glad I'm not living next door the the guy who complained about them.....if that's the case.

It had to be a complaint from someone. I doubt the bylaw officer found them without direction. Like others said, their hands were tied. Next step is for their council to make some changes.  If I was the bylaw officer and I got the complaint, so I had to attack a bunch of kids running a small time business for some scratch to buy bikes. I would do my JOB.... I would go right over to the DB's house or business, who called in and inspect everything they owned, rented or stood beside. I would happily write THEM up about 20 tickets for whatever they were doing AGAINST the rules. Let's face it with all the over regulation we live under now EVERYBODY is breaking some bylaws or codes these days.  Then I would have went told the kids sorry you can't do what you are doing in the current way you are doing. Sadly, I do have to give you this piece of paper because of the rules. Then I would tell them in my spare time after work I would be more than happy to show them how to skirt the bylaw and keep on making some money for their bikes...  I expect my job would be immediately terminated, but then earning a living isn't worth being forced to be such a dick anyway in my opinion. LOL
Didn't Ontario ban non residents that paid for a fishing license from catching their own bait? Only applies to baitfish.
I approve this message lol.  Your a good man...

I approve this message lol.  Your a good man...   If I was the bylaw officer and I got the complaint, so I had to attack a bunch of kids running a small time business for some scratch to buy bikes. Then I would tell them in my spare time after work I would be more than happy to show them how to skirt the bylaw and keep on making some money for their bikes...  I expect my job would be immediately terminated, but then earning a living isn't worth being forced to be such a dick anyway in my opinion. LOL With an attitude like that you should be running for counsil or something, I know I'd be voting for you!!!
I'd put a hundred bucks on this being the case.
I won't you miserable prick!

With an attitude like that you should be running for counsil or something, I know I'd be voting for you!!!  Thanks but I don't  play well enough with others to ever even consider such a thing... There is a reason I have managed to be excused from mandatory staff meetings at the last 3 places I have worked before now, with no repercussions to my employment LOL

Unbelievable!!!!  An 8 and 10 year old selling a few worms and the city goes after them...  http://cornwallfreenews.com/2015/07/city-hall-in-cornwall-ontario-shuts-down-worm-selling-kids-threatens-240-per-day-fines-july-27-2015-cwlpoli/

Unreal.  Some kids making some cash by working. Let them be for frig sakes.  When I was about 10, I made mad money(lol) selling crawfish on rainy lake at 10 cents a piece. Made about $40 a day and I was rollin in cash lol.  Anyhow, this is rediculous.  Let them kids work and provide a service
Cornwall, seems like a great place to raise a family.
Sad ...maybe they should sell drugs instead ..then the city and policing would leave them be

This smells like a local tackle/bait retailer making complaints more less tying the hands of the bylaw officer. Quick trip around Cornwall will likely find a doz biz run out of residence, likely brother laws of the mayor.  You can sometimes get around this by non permanent signage.  Anyway if I was the kid my $240 would be spent on a lawyer because no bylaw # was quoted.

It's the way of the world today. Kids that do try to do something positive and some idiot has to jump all over them instead of encouraging them. What next, are they going to stop little kids from having a lemonade stand? Selling Girl Guide Cookies?
What the heck?!?! I hope it doesent discourage his future endeavors
Don't forget to read all the way down in the article .... it looks like this is being taken care of and the kids will be allowed to sell their worms.
Sorry Simon   I don't see where it says that.  City staff are going insane.   Any fishing clubs in the Cornwall area should be backing these kids up.  Regards

UPDATE City Councilor Justin Towndale issued a statement on the subject: “Earlier today I was made aware of an issue in which a By-Law notice was served to a local family advising that their three children could no longer sell worms from their property. I’ve since met with the family, have reached out to our By-Law supervisor, and contacted my Council colleagues. I’ve been advised that in the past, this same By-Law provision has been used to shut down lemonade stands that were also run by children. My goal is to remedy the current issue and fix it for all going forward. We should let kids be kids.“Thanks,Justin

This smells like a local tackle/bait retailer making complaints more less tying the hands of the bylaw officer. Quick trip around Cornwall will likely find a doz biz run out of residence, likely brother laws of the mayor.  You can sometimes get around this by non permanent signage.  Anyway if I was the kid my $240 would be spent on a lawyer because no bylaw # was quoted. That was my 1st thought as well. Once a complaint is made the bylaw officer's hands are tied, and his job is on the line if he doesn't do his job to the letter.

It's the way of the world today. Kids that do try to do something positive and some idiot has to jump all over them instead of encouraging them. What next, are they going to stop little kids from having a lemonade stand? Selling Girl Guide Cookies? X 2 and yet people can get off with a bit of "stuff" on them or disrupt traffic  with no penalties But some young people who show they want to work in this world and contribute back instead of becoming whinning leaches with their hands out get the gears, a little common sense goes a long ways
All the bait shops pay taxes and licensing fees, the kids don't....you think the government is going to let anybody get away with not giving them their FAIR share
It had to be a complaint from someone. I doubt the bylaw officer found them without direction. Like others said, their hands were tied. Next step is for their council to make some changes.
Sorry guys, but if its taking business away from local tackle shops then I'm for it.  If its just to lay down the law for any other reason then that I would definitely never raise a family there.

All the bait shops pay taxes and licensing fees, the kids don't....you think the government is going to let anybody get away with not giving them their FAIR share I agree with your reasoning but if some of our elected officials reflected back to when they were kids I am sure some of them were doing the same thing, its amazing with time how some people forget the past, my wife and I will still stop and buy lemonade or whatever, baked goods etc, we will always say u should be proud of yourself to work hard to make some money, some kids dont hear enough of that these days , there is always so much negative thrown at them, we sold pears, worms and lemonade in front of the house in Woodbridge and we never put any business out of business,  you were learning some fundamentals of how to make money, how to interact with the public and how to do some simple budgeting, those things are great learing skills
Didn't Ontario ban non residents that paid for a fishing license from catching their own bait?
sell weed, its less trouble.
Becoming more and more communist every day..soon will all work the same hrs same wages and same curfew

All the bait shops pay taxes and licensing fees, the kids don't....you think the government is going to let anybody get away with not giving them their FAIR share They let drug dealers and "ladies of the night" do business all the time and don't collect taxes on those!

They let drug dealers and "ladies of the night" do business all the time and don't collect taxes on those!   Yup, but when they catch them they shut them down...same as the illegal worm sales bussiness

I kind of doubt a local tackle shop will loose a noticeable amount of business to a couple kids selling worms off their front porch?  My guess is that a cranky person in the kids neighborhood didn't like the signs, so they called it in.

You have to remember that the bylaw people don't come around for something like this unless there is a complaint. Like some Richard neighbour. We all seem to have one around.  Good to see the Councillor step in to correct the situation.
Aw, come on Dad, just buy your kids a bike!
Becoming more and more communist every day..soon will all work the same hrs same wages and same curfew Does that mean I will earn what Kathleen Wynne makes? :-)
